name: Dhokla
description: Dhokla is a savoury sponge dish that is native to the Indian state of Gujarat and parts of adjacent states, and is popular throughout the country.

name: Fafda Jalebi
description: Fafda are spicy and crunchy which is made of chickpea consists of long strips of dough which have been deep fried and Jalebi are sweet, tangy and soft fried sweet dipped in sugar.

name: Methi Muthia
description: Methi muthia are fist-shaped deep fried snacks made from dough of whole wheat flour and besan flavoured excitingly with methi, sugar and spices.

name: Muthiya
description: The name is derived from the way it is made, from the 'gripping' action of the hand. It is a vegetarian dish

name: Khandvi
description: It is a famous savory snack in Gujarati cuisine. It is prepared using gram flour and yogurt tightly rolled into bite-sized pieces.

name: Thepla
description: Theplas are famous for breakfast in Gujarat. Every household in Gujarat start their day with hot theplas accompanied with jalebi and fafda.
